overview:
Dr. Mulles is an international executive with more than thirty years of experience in the planning/programming, design and construction of large-scale, multi-billion dollar construction programs.

His multi-award-winning endeavors include projects in Taipei, Bangkok, Singapore and Osaka as well as Dallas; Chicago; St. Louis; San Diego; Los Angeles; central Kansas; southeastern Connecticut; Manassas, VA and Carlisle, PA. He is the Founder and Managing General Partner of Knightsbridge Development located in Batavia, Illinois. Knightsbridge is a design and construction management firm and a Joint Venture Partner with BLR Architects of Lisle, Illinois that is focused on creating faith-based, active adult communities. He has also lead world-class hospitality/entertainment projects for numerous organizations including Universal Studios, the Mohegan Tribe and Aventine Development, LLC. Previously, he was Executive Vice President, Design and Construction with Terravant Land Company and has held similar positions with Universal Studios, Bechtel and Shimizu Corporation.

One such project is The Aventine, a Hyatt destination property in LaJolla, CA. He was a visiting lecturer at Kwansei Gakuin University, Sanda, Japan and at Nanyang Technical University, Republic of Singapore. He has also participated in numerous Japanese and American corporate lecture programs dealing with construction operations and methods as well as managed growth. He holds a Doctorate in Business Administration as well as a Masters Degree in Construction Management with undergraduate studies centered on architecture and civil/structural engineering. He is a decorated US Air Force veteran of the Vietnam War with distinguished service in several combat and base engineering units.
